hospital_administrator.dialogue: Our nurses are doing good work. If the Ministry can't confirm it's having an effect, then it's a verification issue.

health_provider_3.dialogue: This is the job of the verifiers, not us.

twists.name: Checkup Overload
twists.initiating_dialogue: We have been looking at the numbers, and vaccination delivery has risen much faster than projected. We can't explain it.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: For some reason people in this region have been taking advantage of this service much more than others. Perhaps providers are pushing the services too strongly.

coach.dialogue: The simplest solution is to just decrease the incentives for checkups. We could use that money elsewhere, to hire more staff, for example.

feedback.decrease_incentives_2: Makes sense to me. We can use that money to improve other services.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: They all seem to be legitimate, so I don't suspect fraud. Would you like me to go over the paperwork again?

community_verifier.dialogue: We have heard rumors of people going to the hospital and being offered services they don't want.

feedback.maintain_current_rates_2: Smooth sailing ahead. Nice talking to you!

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Really? I haven't noticed anything like that at my hospital. Anyway, I thought vaccinating people was a good thing.

feedback.warn_providers_to_follow_protocols_2: I'll have my staff re-assess these practices.

health_provider_3.dialogue: What's wrong with people getting vaccinated? It's better than the alternative.

twists.name: Wrong Numbers
twists.initiating_dialogue: I have been reviewing Health Provider 2's records, and they do not check out. There is either fraud or accidental misreporting here.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Sorry, I'm kind of up to my elbows in work here, I don't know if I have much advice to contribute to this situation.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I've had some communication with Provider 2 in the past, but I believe he is honest. You should talk to him directly to see what the problem is.

coach.dialogue: This is the first time we've seen this behavior from Provider 2. I'd recommend a warning.

community_verifier.dialogue: I can confirm the numbers do not match up. Very suspicious.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I think my staff is confused about what to report. Frankly, I myself have been confused at times!

feedback.warning_10: I'll talk to my staff and try to settle this.
feedback.sanctions_6: I just put in orders for new equipment. Now I won't be able to afford to pay for them. I think you are taking this too far. It was an honest mistake.
feedback.hold_meeting_to_retrain_on_reporting_pra: I think that will probably help. Let me know when works for you and I'll clear some time.

twists.name: Budget Lines
twists.initiating_dialogue: I received a memo today going over the new national health budget. The ministry has released new hiring guidelines for all providers, but it does not match our goals.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Our own monitors have found mismanagement of funds. They need strict guidelines to provide the necessary services.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_10: This is within the scope of regulation, which is my role. But if you think it's essential, we will step back on this.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If the Ministry is claiming this is necessary, I would take it seriously. A compromise might be to re-work the business plan with Ministry oversight.

coach.dialogue: I'd speak with the Ministry about this right away.

community_verifier.dialogue: I really don't think that this is in my wheelhouse; maybe somebody else on your team would have a better idea?

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I have found some mismanagement of funds in the past as well. However, we are supposed to be granting autonomy.

feedback.revise_business_plan_5: I don't believe this will be constructive, but I'm willing to try.

twists.name: Fraud
twists.initiating_dialogue: I just received the reports from Provider 4, and they are rife with fraudulent claims. It goes without saying that they should not be paid, but more needs to be done.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Quite the mess. This is the worst partner yet. Do what you need to do, but I recommend terminating this contract.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: A warning might not be enough here. Sanctions seem appropriate.

coach.dialogue: This is only their first year. A warning might do the trick.

community_verifier.dialogue: Sorry, I'm kind of up to my elbows in work here, I don't know if I have much advice to contribute to this situation.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I really don't think that this is in my wheelhouse; maybe somebody else on your team would have a better idea?

health_provider_4.dialogue: What are you accusing me of, exactly? I'd like a record of this for my attorneys.

feedback.sanctions_7: What is this? I can sue you for breach of contract.
feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_6: Who else will you contract? You've chased everyone away.

twists.name: Field Records
twists.initiating_dialogue: We are having difficulty tracking the effectiveness of travelling nurses in the field. We can't confirm they are meeting goals or having positive impacts on indicators.

feedback.increase_funding_for_verifiers_2: Really? I don't think we should be rewarding mismanagement.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: It might help if they were clearing their movements through my office. Then we would know where they are going, and that they are headed where they're needed.

coach.dialogue: Our CBO partners should be confirming all of this. I don't think it's the nurses' fault. The verifiers need to know that if they can't adequately do the work, they can be replaced.

feedback.centralize_control_over_travelling_nurse: I'm wary of adding another level of bureaucracy to this, but it may help...

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The records filed by travelling nurses are sloppier and often late, since they are in the field instead of the hospital.

community_verifier.dialogue: We often do not hear that a nurse has been to visit a patient until after she is long gone, so it's difficult to verify everything.

feedback.warn_community_verifiers_2: We'll try to come up with a strategy to tackle this. It can't be insurmountable.

feedback.require_nurses_to_return_to_file_2: Many of my facilities are not much better than the field, and it will add to our own filing burden.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Our nurses are doing good work. If the Ministry can't confirm it's having an effect, then it's a verification issue.

health_provider_4.dialogue: This is the job of the verifiers, not us.

twists.name: More Fraud
twists.initiating_dialogue: The fourth quarter reports are in and our review has found many suspicious claims from Provider 4. This is becoming a habit, and needs to stop.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: This provider has been nothing but trouble. I recommend terminating this contract.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Severe sanctions seem to be in order. This facility has been raising red flags all year.

coach.dialogue: Honestly, Provider 4 has been terrible to work with. I do not look forward to working with them again in the future. Terminating the contract may be warranted.

community_verifier.dialogue: I have heard from some people that Provider 4 has the worst service in Zariba.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Sorry, I'm kind of up to my elbows in work here, I don't know if I have much advice to contribute to this situation.

health_provider_4.dialogue: The mistake is on the other party. I have been doing everything by the book.

feedback.warning_12: I'll pass this on to my staff.
feedback.sanctions_8: So I pay for the verifier's mistakes? Ridiculous.
feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_7: Who else will you contract? You've chased everyone away.

path_config.prompt_year_1: Thank you for joining us for the end of year meeting. It seems like your plan implementation is going smoothly, yes? That said, we would like to know if you need anything approved through us to make the plan run more efficiently. We are currently delivering services through an NGO, though if things aren't going as well it isn’t too late to switch to a PBF system.
path_config.prompt_year_2: You've made it to the end of year two. I hope you are checking your indicators and making sure the RBF plan is running smoothly. I understand you’re personally invested in this NGO contract, but I foresee problems down the lineI understand you’re personally invested in the NGO, but I foresee problems down the line Is there anything you need from us?

choices.text: Change from a PBC focused plan to PBF focused plan by firing the NGO
Change from a PBC focused plan to PBF focused plan by firing the NGO

problems.name: Lack of Procedure
problems.initiating_dialogue: With all these changes, my providers have expressed a lot of general confusion about roles, and the ministry hasn't been able to help. Can you clarify this for me?

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We can handle distributing the work.

feedback.give_ministry_more_power: All right, I understand. I'll inform the staff here.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I can improve on the literature the ministry has put out.

coach.dialogue: It's always handy to have something written down for people to look at.

feedback.stakeholder_meeting: I'll talk to everyone and make sure they understand what we tried to get across about proper roles.""

third_party_verifier.dialogue: It would be good to deal with this before the different agencies start getting testy with each other.

community_verifier.dialogue: I'm worried this is going to affect the care people get.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I keep getting different answers from the NGO and the Ministry. Can you talk to them about it?

problems.name: Process versus Results
problems.initiating_dialogue: Look. I know we haven't hit the numbers you laid out, but we got a lot of good work done. We can easily make our marks next quarter if the payer issues us our bonus for this period.

feedback.warn_but_allow_payment_once_1: This will help us do even more good work!
feedback.deny_payment_1: We're working with little enough as it is.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: What do the providers think? They should have a pretty good idea if the NGO is at least trying to hit their goals.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If they think giving them the money for what they did get done will help next time, we can pay them this once.

coach.dialogue: I'm worried that if we give them the bonus this time it'll set a precedent.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: They were upfront about not meeting your goals, but it's your decision.

community_verifier.dialogue: I understand that results get paid, but if we don't pay them, my people won't get any treatment, let alone too little.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: They're trying. I'm seeing it in my hospitals.

problems.name: Government versus Organization
problems.initiating_dialogue: The NGO's giving us the run-around when we ask to counter-verify their reports. You need to get them to realize their presence here depends on their transparency.

feedback.cease_counter_verification: If you think they don't need more looking into, that's fine, I trust you.
feedback.clarification_of_roles_1: Next time, let's try to avoid this by making everyone's job clear beforehand. Thanks.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I'm with the Dep. Minister on this. We are responsible for how the NGO operates.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_1: All right, I understand. I'll inform the staff here.

ngo_manager.dialogue: We verify internally and talk to the other verifiers. Don't you think this would be a little much?

coach.dialogue: The problem doesn't have to do with anyone but the NGO and the Third Party Verifier. Hammer it out with them.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: We don't need the government to counter-verify. We're handling it.

community_verifier.dialogue: I think there's enough oversight in what we're doing. This shouldn't be the role of the Ministry.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: It wouldn't be a lot more paperwork for us to submit for counter-verification, but I don't know that it's necessary.

problems.name: Managerial Autonomy
problems.initiating_dialogue: My hospitals can't hire good staff because the NGO is strangling the budget. I don't know how they expect to reach their goals if they won't let us give good care.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We have a pretty good sense of how budgeting worked and where we can improve it if you give us the authority.

feedback.comply_with_ngo_budget_1: OK, we'll make do. We always have.

ngo_manager.dialogue: This is results based financing. We're responsible for the results, so let us decide on the financing.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_2: We can just focus on this, then. That works for me.
feedback.move_authority_to_ministry_1: I really thought we were supposed to handle this, but if they Ministry wants to, that's fine.

coach.dialogue: We can probably handle this without a lot of shuffling. Just remind everyone what they're supposed to be doing.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm seeing the hospitals struggling, but that might just be growing pains.

community_verifier.dialogue: My only concern is people not getting care because the budget keeps getting tied up in arguments.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Will you talk to the Dep. Minister? I have hiring to do, and that's a lot of paperwork. Have you done hiring before? There is a lot of paperwork!

problems.name: Process Versus Results
problems.initiating_dialogue: Vaccination prices went up, so we couldn't hit our numbers again. But if we don't get our bonus, next quarter it'll be a disaster.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: You can ask the Regional Director and providers directly. The NGO wants autonomy, so you'll have to do your research.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: No, they didn't meet their goals, but that doesn't mean my providers and their patients should suffer for it. We're between a rock and hard place.

feedback.warn_but_allow_payment_once_2: It's good to know we can count on you, just like you're counting on us.
feedback.deny_payment_2: We're struggling with these numbers as it is. It hurts patients when we don't have money to work with.

coach.dialogue: I don't think the NGO is managing as well as they could, but maybe we need to adjust our expectations.

feedback.revise_indicators: OK, at year's end I'll sit the fundholder down with the NGO and we'll figure out some realistic goals. In the meantime, we'll hold payment.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: It's the same as last time, and until someone says they're making numbers when they're actually making them up, I'm not much help.

community_verifier.dialogue: The other day I followed up with a woman who vaccinated her son against dengue right before the mosquitos got bad. The numbers aren't great, but if the payments stop, that'll be worse.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: The other day I followed up with a woman who vaccinated her son against dengue right before the mosquitos got bad. The numbers aren't great, but if the payments stop, that'll be worse.

problems.name: Reach
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're seeing underserved populations throughout the south. The NGO really seems to be falling short of their promises, at least in this area.

feedback.increase_funding_for_ngo: You realize you're rewarding these people for failure? I don't want to step in on this issue. Don't make me.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: The health care providers are working with the NGO according to the guidelines we laid out. We can go back to the manual and fix the problems in our policies.

ngo_manager.dialogue: It's been a lot harder to reach some populations than we expected, especially down there. Those people are more entrenched in traditional medicine, and that's a big hump for us to get over when we can only afford the health care itself.

feedback.contract_additional_ngo_at_years_end: I think we could have done it, but it would be a lot of work to reach that province.
feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_1: We can't, cannot, get to absolutely everyone, so you're making it impossible to get health care for everyone else.

coach.dialogue: Look, we have one group running things pretty well for most of the country. Maybe we need someone to run support for them who's more used to this kind of issue.

feedback.revise_operating_manual: OK. I'll hunker down and get to work on the new manual, hammer some things out.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm sure they are having trouble getting to some people, but no informational campaign is going to reach everybody.

community_verifier.dialogue: You can always just guide the NGO on how they should address this. It might be kind of micro-manage-y, but that's what you have a coach for, right?

hospital_administrator.dialogue: That is why you brought the NGO in, to get people treated. There might be someone who could do it better.

problems.name: Arguments
problems.initiating_dialogue: I don't even know what's going on, but our stakeholders are bickering and it's gumming up the works.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: I'm tired of the NGO acting up every opportunity, and I'd really rather not deal with them anymore.

feedback.clarification_of_roles: That's sorted out. Just, you know, be sure you're writing all this down so next time these issues don't crop up.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: The NGO keeps trying to order me around and I know how to do my job. And even if I didn't, I don't work for them.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I didn't realize I wasn't supposed to oversee the way care was administered.

feedback.warn_ngo_2: Why is it that whenever there's an issue, we're made out to be the bad guy? We're doing our best to help these people.
feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_2: I don't understand why you brought us on in the first place if you were going to fire us for doing the work.

feedback.hold_stakeholder_meeting_2: Considering that the problem in the first place was everyone sniping at each other, I guess the meeting went pretty well.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I can't be of much help with this. It helps for me to be pretty neutral.

community_verifier.dialogue: I am so tired of all this finger pointing. You have to be too, I know.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: The way I see it, and this is just my opinion, is that the people at the NGO and the Director of Regional Health Services are the ones who need to figure this out. I just want to run my hospitals.

problems.name: Unit Costs
problems.initiating_dialogue: Look, I don't really know what you and the NGO have worked out, but I need to be authorized to purchase supplies at the right costs. Can you tell them to lighten these restrictions some?

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We've been whittling down whose job is whose throughout this process, so you don't have to tell me this isn't my place, but were it up to me, I'd cancel the NGO contract.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: The Ministry of Health has been handling these budgets for a long time. It wasn't perfect, but it worked better than this.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I know that to the Hospital Administrator, these stipulations seem really stringent, but you brought us on in part to reign in spending.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_4: OK. I'm just trying to make this work as smoothly and efficiently as possible.

coach.dialogue: I'll ask, because this seems to be an ongoing problem: is that the NGO's position? They seem to be overstepping their role.

feedback.move_authority_to_ministry: The Ministry already has a lot going on, but I guess they can handle local hospital budgeting, too.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: If they can't agree on a budget, I'm not going to have any cases to verify. And I like my job.

community_verifier.dialogue: If I were you, and I'm offering this as someone who lives here, ask the Ministry and your coach what to do. The Ministry gets the last call and the NGO doesn't.

feedback.comply_with_ngo_budget_2: I'll comply, but I'll have to cut that money from somewhere.

problems.name: Contract Management
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're still waiting on the fundholder to pay us. The Finance Minister's approval process has hamstrung us, and we need to get our money to pay our people.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: This is something I had to learn early on when I switched from practicing medicine to politics: if you can't cut something out of the budget, just stop budgeting for it. Just terminate the contract so we won't have to go through this.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I get where the Dep. Minister is coming from, but I see people getting treated. We need to get everyone on the same page.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I know that to the Hospital Administrator, these stipulations seem really stringent, but you brought us on in part to reign in spending.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_3: I get it that this has been stressful, so this might be for the best, but I hope you can handle this. For the patients' sakes.
feedback.expidite_payment_and_service_delivery: Thank you. This is going to work much better.

coach.dialogue: It's probably too late to do it now, but before the year's out we should look into getting someone who can manage the contract so we don't have to go to bat every time there's an argument.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_5: Sure, you can remind the Ministry and NGO, again, who's supposed to do what. But that will only work until the next argument.
feedback.hire_agency: I know this is more money spent, but we need to focus on lowering the infant mortality rate, not refereeing a fight between adults.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm sure you're getting good advice from the people who are writing the checks. They are, at least, smart enough to know what they want.

community_verifier.dialogue: You have an advisor, and that's good. Someone thinking about the big picture. Great. But maybe you should ask the people who are using this money to help people.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Get the NGO their money! I have no empty beds! The doctors and nurses keep asking me when we're going to be able to do something about it and the best I can tell them is, well, I try to explain how all this is supposed to work. And that explanation doesn't do anything for a head wound.

problems.name: More Arguments
problems.initiating_dialogue: I'm getting a different answer from everyone, so I'll ask you to straighten them out. The Ministry, NGO, and health care providers can't agree on who has jurisdiction where and what we're supposed to do for patients.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Best way to win an argument? End the conversation.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_6: I do hope this is the last time we have to go through this.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I'm only doing what I thought you asked me to. If I'm not, let me know.

feedback.warn_ngo_3: OK, we'll back off of telling the health care providers what they're supposed to do.
feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_4: The whole reason you brought us on was nothing was getting accomplished. That's what we were doing.

coach.dialogue: The health care providers are caught between the people paying them and the Ministry they report to. Those are the problems that need solving.

feedback.hold_stakeholder_meeting_3: For a problem like this, a truce is about as good as we can hope for. Well, maybe not a truce, as such. More of a cease fire.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: There's plenty of work to be done without these arguments.

community_verifier.dialogue: The other day, a woman was getting her prenatal checkup. She's in the stirrups and the doctor had to leave the exam room to get lectured on what all care she was supposed to give. That has got to stop.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I couldn't do what the NGO Director does. No argument there. But they are not so good at their job that they can do mine, too.

problems.name: Excuses
problems.initiating_dialogue: We've talked about the problems of expectations. We can meet our goals better if we get our bonuses.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: They claim they're doing such a bang up job. Are they?

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: It's a lot easier to work with people when they're getting paid. Just sayin'.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I'm only doing what I thought you asked me to. If I'm not, let me know.

feedback.warn_but_allow_payment_once_3: It's good to know we can count on you, just like you're counting on us.
feedback.deny_payment_3: We're struggling with these numbers as it is. It hurts patients when we don't have money to work with.

coach.dialogue: Maybe they're doing the best that can be done. I don't know. It can't hurt to make sure we're being realistic in our expectations.

feedback.revise_indicators_at_end_of_year_2: OK, at year's end let's all sit everyone down and we'll figure out what would be realistic goals for the money we have to work with.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: Have you read 'Things Fall Apart'? It might be a good idea.

community_verifier.dialogue: You're within your rights not to pay the NGO, it's true. But people have a right to health care.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: As much as I've butt heads with the NGO, I'd like to continue treating patients.

problems.name: Micromanagement
problems.initiating_dialogue: I keep getting calls from the Minister of Health's office checking in on us, telling us what we could be doing better, telling us how to handle things. That's your job, right?

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We need the NGO to be accountable and if that's a problem with them, we're not going to be able to work with them.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_7: We keep going around and around with this. For the future, it is not your position to clarify ours.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We're not making any unreasonable requests. In fact, they're pretty sound, and the Ministry does not need push back for looking into the health of its constituents. At least make them think harder about complaining next time.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_5: Best of luck, but this is not as easy as you think it is.
feedback.sanction_ngo_1: You can slap us on the wrist, but we are getting people help.

coach.dialogue: However unlikely it seems at this point, maybe the NGO doesn't really understand who's calling the shots.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: *Helpless laugh* I don't know!

community_verifier.dialogue: I wouldn't say checking in constitutes micromanagement, but I'm not seeing these memos, so I don't know.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: The Ministry signs the checks. Sometimes, we get to cash them and get people healthy. Ask them and whoever they have helping you.

problems.name: Poor Stewardship
problems.initiating_dialogue: I can tell you right now what's happening because I've seen it before. People all along the chain are skimming money because the NGO and Ministry have both backed off of their responsibilities. When there's no clear authority, corruption sets in. This is what's happening here.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: It looks like the NGO is making things worse, not better. If the NGO isn't doing their job, you terminate their contract.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I can imagine what the Dep. Minister told you, but I'm going to advise sanctioning them. They've been with us for a while now, after all.

ngo_manager.dialogue: You're going to threaten to terminate our contract because somewhere along the line there's corruption. You should probably see where it's happening.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_6: We've been getting kids vaccinated against fatal diseases, improving care, saving lives. That is what you are screwing up here.
feedback.sanction_ngo_2: I don't know what you expect me to do with more sanctions. I'm trying to manage a complex network, and this only complicates it more.

coach.dialogue: This could ruin everything you've built here. If it does, the Minister and Regional Director will have to deal with it. It's only fair you go to them with this.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_8: People are starting to think this is a band-aid, smoothing things over and rereading job descriptions every time something serious happens. This is pretty serious, here.

feedback.sanction_verifier: I have been working for you this whole time, and it should tell you something that the NGO wanted me fired.

community_verifier.dialogue: This is kind of a mess. I don't want this to turn into a bigger problem than it has to be.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: There is no evidence that anyone in my hospital is profiting unduly. IF any such information were to become apparent, I would be the first to recognize and rectify the situation, but as there is none, I have no responsibility to dignify your accusation with a response. ... No, you may not take a look at our books for yourself. ... No, not my personal bank account, either.

path_config.prompt_year_1: Thank you for joining us for the end of year meeting. It seems like your plan implementation is going smoothly, yes? That said, we would like to know if you need anything approved through us to make the plan run more efficiently. We have reports that granting providers more autonomy is a viable modification to this plan.
path_config.prompt_year_2: You've made it to the end of year two. I hope you are checking your indicators and making sure the RBF plan is running smoothly. Is there anything you need from us? Granting more autonomy to providers is still a viable measure if you feel it would help us hit our indicator goals.

choices.text: Modify plan to grant providers more autonomy
Modify plan to grant providers more autonomy

problems.name: Government overreach on verification
problems.initiating_dialogue: The independant verifier and the health providers seem to have built a coalition to box us out of the verification proccess. This plan gives us the authority to verify any and all reports, but they're pushing back.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: There are other health providers in the region we could use. This is the largest, but that doesn't mean it's the best. Sanctions would get this message across.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: The plan's faltering a bit. Are you sure this is the hospital adminstrator's fault and not some issue with the business plan? It might be on us.

feedback.sanctions_11: I'll make sure this gets into everyone's mailbox as a high priority. Don't worry: I won't write the subject in caps lock again.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The data says they are doing a good job managing funds. There are a lot of unecessary costs.

community_verifier.dialogue: I would talk directly to them if I were you. Maybe they're seeing something we aren't.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I don't know about the hospital, we're trying to meet goals without a lot of supplies or money to buy more.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: We're doing our best here. The plan is complicated, and not all my people have had time to look at it while treating patients, filing their records, that sort of thing. We'll get used to operating within the budget soon.

feedback.warning_and_retraining_2: We are trying to work with the money we have. We don't need to be chastised for that.

problems.name: Poor Management
problems.initiating_dialogue: The hospital administrator and I were reviewing the hospital's business plan and they are not doing a good job managing their money. Even with our payments they're operating at a loss.

feedback.ask_reduce_oversight: This isn't what we had in mind when we started the project. I don't see how we can, in good faith, approve costs we haven't verified.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We need the authority to verify things as we have always done in the past. It seems unethical to OK payments that we haven't verified.

feedback.streamline_speed_verification_process: This will put some strain on our office, but I think we can get the extra work done.

coach.dialogue: The plan spreads authority across multiple stakeholders, including the Ministry of Health. Whether it's a good thing, or a bad thing, that's their concern. Let's send a memo gently reminding everybody of that.

feedback.circulate_memo_reaffirming_ministry_auth: I'll make sure this gets into everyone's mailbox as a high priority. Don't worry: I won't write the subject in caps lock again.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: You hired us to verify reports. Having a separate body double everything we're doing is worse than redundant. It's counter-productive.

feedback.warn_verifier_1: All right. We'll let everyone look over our shoulders all they want. But to say it's inefficient is an understatement.

community_verifier.dialogue: We're tired of submitting our reports in triplicate. The work we do is hard enough without all this paperwork.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I like working with the government, I do. But doubling verification doubles the time before I get my money, and my budget is pretty tight as it is.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Having three levels of verification sounds like overkill to me. And my staff is confused about who's actually in charge.

problems.name: Bad Record Keeping
problems.initiating_dialogue: The Clinic submitted their reports to us, but there were some inconsistencies. When we asked to see their records, they couldn't supply them.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If they aren't following the rules, they shouldn't be paid. A penalty may also be in order.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: All providers in my region know the requirements for keeping records. Something must be wrong. I'd talk to them.

coach.dialogue: Can't imagine why they aren't keeping records. Last time I talked to them, they said everything was fine and they didn't want my help.

feedback.capacity_building_help: Help capacity building: When I'm over there next I'll check on their on-the-spot training, figure out where they're making mistakes.

community_verifier.dialogue: My team has had no issue keeping records. I wonder what the issue is at the clinics?

clinic_manager.dialogue: I wish I could tell you what happened. The only thing I can think of is someone sent our originals to the Ministry instead of copies. But I assure you, we are keeping records. With all the strictures you have in place, my staff is having a hard time keeping up with patient care and paperwork.

feedback.hold_payment_2: I understand you have to do this. We'll make due and improve next quarter.
feedback.sanctions_12: I don't think the answer to our staff problem is to cut our allocation. This will affect patient treatment.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Perhaps they just need some more time to get used to all of this. Cut them some slack this once, and they'll figure it out as we go.

problems.name: Lack of Supplies
problems.initiating_dialogue: Bad news: We're running surveys of patients from the hospitals and local clinics, and at every focus group, someone reports being turned away without services.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If people are being turned away, it's because funds are being mismanaged. Sanctioning them may be the only thing that providers will pay attention to.

feedback.grant_facilities_autonomy: It's a bad idea to give more responsibility to an organization that's done such a bad job managing their resources.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: This is a serious problem. It would hard enough getting people to hospitals if services were abundant.

feedback.increase_supply_budget: We've increased the budget every year and that hasn't solved the problem yet. That isn't to say our health care providers are the problem, only that it might not be budgetary.

coach.dialogue: I'm not sure why, but these facilities are always low on supplies. Maybe they just need more money.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The numbers are poor, but at least the facilities are being honest about it.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I've spoken to the RBF coach about this a number of times. If we don't have basic supplies, we cannot treat patients.

feedback.unlocks_sanction_providers: You can't seriously be asking us to do more with even less. It costs money to provide quality care.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: We put in requests for supplies, but it's forever before they're filled. And when they do, we get too much of some things, and not enough of others. If we could simply order our own supplies directly, this wouldn't be a problem, but the Ministry says what we're allowed to get down to the last syringe.

feedback.warn_providers: I'm at a loss. I'll hold a meeting with my staff and the RBF Coach, try to figure out how to solve this.

problems.name: Staff_Issues
problems.initiating_dialogue: In many of my focus groups, there's an air of mistrust of the hospitals and clinics. People who go have experienced terrible service and are telling their neighbors not to go.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Dialogue is Missing

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Providers in my region complain often of over-stressed staff. They have not enough people working with not enough supplies, and that's bound to affect service.

coach.dialogue: Customer service is a huge part of quality of care. Increase incentives, whatever we need to do, we have to get staff to be nicer to patients.

feedback.increase_customer_service_incentives: I'll let everyone know. I wouldn't mind something like this around here. Hey, if I smile more, will you give me a raise?

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I keep hearing these horror stories. A man told me a nurse yelled at his son when he was scared of getting a shot. That's unacceptable. It might not be my place to say so, but firing staff and hiring new people might be appropriate.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I've spoken with my staff about this on a number of occasions. Even with incentives in place, if they can't meet expectations patients can't be made happy. Sure, understaffing is part of it, but we don't have the medicine we need half the time. People get angry when we don't have anything to give them.

feedback.warn_providers_2: We're overworked as it is. But fine. I'll see what I can do.
feedback.reorganize_staff: It's great that you can hand down these decrees of who I may and may not hire. I'm sure that while my new phlebotomist keeps sticking people, they'll do it with a smile.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I can tell my staff to be nicer, but they're working hard to meet goals, deal with patients who come in frustrated, and all on a shoestring budget. With all that, it's hard to tell them to smile or else.

feedback.sanctions_13: Making it harder for me to do my job is not the answer to our problems. We need to fix the actual problem. No, I don't know what that would be, because I'm trying to hold a hospital together.

problems.name: Mismanagement
problems.initiating_dialogue: Coach

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: I have a meeting with the Minister of Education later this week about the curricula in our teaching hospitals. I do not have time to supervise you telling the hospital to spend money like we tell them to.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Have you considered that there is a flaw in the business plan? If the Hospital Administrator is straying from it so often, it might need to be reevaluated.

feedback.revise_business_plan_6: I'll set up a meeting with the purchasing agency this week to revise for next quarter.
feedback.sanctions_and_retraining_on_use_of_finan: I'll make some time this week for a retraining session and try to get this facility to understand exactly how these tools should be used. I'm informing the regulator about the sanctions now.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm not saying the coach isn't perceptive, but if a cursory look around the hospital is all you need to tell something's not right, it's probably not fraudulent.

community_verifier.dialogue: I doubt they're trying to pull one over on you. I had the worst time with my finances all through my 20's; managing money is hard.

clinic_manager.dialogue: We're all short staffed, but I've found ways to make it work.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I can't control my hiring budget, and my supplies remain squeezed. I'm short staffed and constantly running out of things. So how can I possibly meet the demmands of this business plan?

feedback.warning_13: I'm doing my best, but I don't know how long I can hold onto my staff like this.

problems.name: Transparency
problems.initiating_dialogue: There is an ongoing issue with the Clinic Manager. They looked like small stuff, but since they've had issues with record keeping, I looked more closely. I found some forms that are exact duplicates of others, which means they're filing duplicate reports to boost their numbers.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We cannot afford this kind of impropriety. Deal with this.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: This is troubling. Look into other providers for next year's contract.

coach.dialogue: This is a big deal. Honesty aside, we need accurate numbers to know what kind of progress we're making. We need to send a very clear message: unvalidated reports will not be paid.

feedback.warning_14: I'll warn them. Hopefully we won't see this again.

community_verifier.dialogue: That's not my department, exactly, but it sounds pretty suspicious.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I told my staff to start keeping better records. I can talk to them again and stress its importance...

feedback.sanctions_14: Our budget is strained as it is. I'll have to fire people. Which will make it harder to meet your goals. And so on until we have to close and your plan fails.
feedback.strong_sanctions_2: This is a disaster! For such a small error? I've been bending over backwards to meet the Ministry's spartan budgetting requirements. We'll need to let staff go. I'm going to have to fire my people because you want to, what, make an example of us? Thanks for putting that on me.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Don't go too hard on them. These clinics do good work.

problems.name: Midwives
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're having a lot of trouble hitting goals for facility births. We're short staffed, especially when it comes to midwives.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If you can verify this, we'd be willing to discuss the budget.

feedback.grant_providers_autonomy_to_hire_staff: This is a significant change to the plan. Let's discuss this at the end of the year once we see how it's panned out.
feedback.request_a_budget_line_from_ministry: We can allow this, but I want to see reports on the results.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: That would explain the struggling indicators on facility births.  An alternative I've considered is allowing outreach staff to serve as midwives in the field, if facilities are overstressed.

coach.dialogue: The Hospital Administrator has complained to me in private about not being able to hire staff members without Ministry approva. I told him the plan is firm about how these decisions are made.

feedback.allow_outreach_staff_to_act_as_midwives: This would boost facility births for sure, but it's a bit of a cheat since they won't technically be in facilities. But as long as women are giving birth safely, right?

third_party_verifier.dialogue: You should talk to the Clinic Manager: they're working under similar conditions and should have insight. Run it by your RBF Coach, too.

community_verifier.dialogue: I've heard this complaint from several women in my community. They say there are long waits to meet with midwives. Everyone seems stressed out. Pregnancy is trying even in the best of conditions.

clinic_manager.dialogue: We have had a similar problem here. And since you mention it, granting us the autonomy to hire whatever staff would go a long way to fix this.

problems.name: Budget Lines
problems.initiating_dialogue: I received a memo today on the new national health budget. The ministry released new hiring guidelines for all providers, but they don't match the goals you gave us.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Our monitors have found mismanagement of funds. Hospitals should provide the necessary services with what we give them to work with.

feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers: Hiring and firing is within the scope of regulation, which is my role. But if you think it's essential, we'll step back.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If the Ministry is claiming this is necessary, I would take it seriously. A compromise might be to re-work the business plan with Ministry oversight.

coach.dialogue: We've been running into this problem for three years now. The only way I see this working in the future is cutting the Ministry out of the picture and letting providers hire staff.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I have noticed some inconsistencies in the data that indicate funds are being mismanaged. The providers might benefit from tighter rules.

community_verifier.dialogue: I don't understand the need for these new guidelines, but then again, I don't work in the hospital.

clinic_manager.dialogue: The RBF Coach shares my concerns about micromanagement, so I know that I'm not going crazy seeing a problem in how things are getting run. We need you to do something before this becomes a real fight.

feedback.rework_business_plan: I don't believe this will be constructive, but I'm willing to try.

problems.name: Failed Inspection
problems.initiating_dialogue: Hey, we just received a memo telling us we failed a quality of care inspection, but I disagree with the assessment. We're doing a great job, considering the strain we're under.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Quality of care is important insofar as it enables better and more services to be delivered. It might be that the clinic is delivering as much good care as they can given they're circumstances.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I recognize that their job is difficult, but quality of care is one of the indicators we are working to improve.

coach.dialogue: We can't waffle on quality of care. It's crucial to the plan. I understnd they rely on these payments, but they need to know that we don't make exceptions.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: They failed my inspection, plain and simple. A review is not necessary.

community_verifier.dialogue: These are small clinics, with very little operating budget. Denying payment will cause immediate harm to the community.

feedback.review_the_inspection_2: Thank you! I think you'll find our quality sufficient.
feedback.warning_15: I don't know what we can do to improve things before the year is out, but I guess we'll have to try.
feedback.deny_review_2: I'm looking at half a year without payments, last quarter and this one, and you won't even consider my point of view.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I can tell you it is painful to miss a payment, even when things are going well. What harm is there in reviewing the inspection?

problems.name: Prescriptions
problems.initiating_dialogue: I've been interviewing patients, and at least at the clinics there's a serious quality of care issue. People have been leaving with what appears to be completely wrong perscriptions.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: That's unnacceptable. I think it's time we looked for someone else to fulfill these duties. There are other health care providers in Zariba.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We must conduct an investigation right away. Begin by speaking directly with the health providers and find out why this is happening.

feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_8: I understand. I will inform the Clinic Manager of this, and begin the search for a replacement ASAP.

coach.dialogue: Maybe we've been incentivising the wrong things. Prescriptions make patients happy, whether or not they're correct. I've prioritized happy patients, maybe above best practices.

feedback.reduce_incentives_for_customer_service: That's an approach I hadn't thought of. Let's implement it, see what happens.
feedback.tie_incentives_directly_to_protocol: I'll work on implementing this change. I think this'll be a turning point for the plan.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: How did I miss this!? I'll look more closely to see what else the clinics are misreporting.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I run an entire network of clinics, and unfortnately I can't be everywhere at once. In the end, I am responsible, but I feel I am not being given the support I need.

feedback.warning_16: You're asking me to discipline my clinics for avoiding fights with patients who think medicine means walking out with a bottle of pills. I also have to discipline them for not making patients happy. I'll try to figure out some way to balance those.
feedback.sanctions_15: You cut our funds when patients complain, which they do because we don't prescribe them drugs. Then, when we give them what they want, you cut our funds again. You need to figure out what you want.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: At first I was shocked to hear this, but the more I thought about it, the more it makes sense. Patients don't know the difference, and if we're incentivizing happy patients, the wrong medicine is better than no medicine.

problems.name: Missing Goals
problems.initiating_dialogue: I'm disappointed to say this, but things are not going well. Providers routinely miss goals, and our indicators have not risen as predicted. We're thinking about declaring the plan DOE and cancelling it for next year. This would mean a return to traditional financing.

feedback.grant_providers_autonomy: Let's schedule a meeting to discuss this at the end of the year. I might be able to persuade the Minister to give us one more year with an altered plan.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: As much as it pains me to say so, I agree with the Deputy Minister. We need to change tactics.

coach.dialogue: There must be another solution here. I'm committed to making this plan work. Even with new health providers taking on contracts.

feedback.return_to_traditional_financing: Part of me feels like the past three years have been wasted, but I guess there's no sense in throwing good money out after bad. It's been a pleasure working with you.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm seeing some good done at the ground level, but I have no idea how that reflects nationally.

community_verifier.dialogue: I can tell you that, if the problems I keep seeing in paperwork are any indication, you're in trouble. Then again, filling out forms and caring for patients aren't the same thing.

clinic_manager.dialogue: My clinics could handle this better if you shifted some resources away from the hospital and to my network. Hire another contractor to fill the gaps and let me do my job.

feedback.terminate_both_health_contracts_of_provi: If I couldn't make this work, nobody can. The past three years has been one unmitigated disaster.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I heard through the grapevine what's happening. I know there have been issues, but I believe the problem is and has been beurocracy from the Ministry's offices. If you grant us autonomy to hire staff as needed and order supplies to fill our patients' needs, things have to improve.

feedback.terminate_hospital_contract_and_redirect: Well. This is disappointing. I was doing everything I could to make this plan work.

path_config.prompt_year_1: Thank you for joining us for the end of year meeting. It seems like your plan implementation is going smoothly, yes? That said, we would like to know if you need anything approved through us to make the plan run more efficiently. We are currently delivering services through an NGO, though if things aren't going as well it isn’t too late to switch to a PBF system.
path_config.prompt_year_2: You've made it to the end of year two. I hope you are checking your indicators and making sure the RBF plan is running smoothly. I understand you’re personally invested in this NGO contract, but I foresee problems down the lineI understand you’re personally invested in the NGO, but I foresee problems down the line Is there anything you need from us?

choices.text: Change from a PBC focused plan to PBF focused plan by replacing the NGO with public services
Change from a PBC focused plan to PBF focused plan by replacing the NGO with public services

problems.name: Slow Verification
problems.initiating_dialogue: I need a little help here. The independent verifier and the Hospital Administrator have built a coalition to box us out of the verification process. This plan gives us the authority to verify any and all reports, but they're pushing back.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Before we hired the NGO, counterverifying was our responsibility. This is a role we were better suited for.

feedback.ask_reduce_oversight_2: This defeats the purpose of our plans. How can we approve funding in good faith if we haven't verified it ourselves?

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Having three levels of verification sounds like overkill to me. And it's confusing to the health providers. Who is the actual final authority on these matters?

feedback.streamline_speed_verification_process_2: This will put some strain on our office. I'll do my best to get my office to comply with this.

feedback.revert_counterverification_1: You hired us to manage this! Why not give us a chance?

coach.dialogue: The plan spreads authority across multiple stakeholders, including the Ministry of Health. Whether it's a good thing or a bad thing, that's on them. Let's send around a memo.

feedback.circulate_memo_reaffirming_ministry_auth: I'll make sure everyone gets eyes on this.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: We were hired by the ministry and the NGO to do this work. Having a separate body double everything we're doing is worse than redundant, it's counter-productive.

feedback.warn_verifier_2: All right. We'll back off. But to say the process is inefficient would be an understatement.

community_verifier.dialogue: We're tired of submitting our reports in triplicate. My job is hard enough without all this bureaucracy.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I have a good relationship with the government, but double-checking takes twice as long. That means it takes twice the time for us to get paid, and my budget can't take that strain.

problems.name: Process V. Results
problems.initiating_dialogue: Look. I know we haven't hit the numbers you laid out, but we got a lot of good work done. We can easily make our marks next quarter if the payor issues us our bonus for this period.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: What do the providers think? They should have a pretty good idea if the NGO is at least trying to hit their goals

feedback.increase_budget_for_supplies_1: This will need approval from the Finance Ministry, but it could improve things. Still, the claims should not be paid this quarter.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If they think giving them the money for what they did get done will help next time, we can pay them this once.

feedback.allow_payments_once_4: This will help us do even more good work! Thank you.
feedback.deny_payment_4: We're working with little enough as it is. If we can't reach our goals with what we have, what makes you think we'll do better with less?

coach.dialogue: I'm worried that if we give them the bonus this time it'll set a precedent.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: They were upfront about not meeting your goals, but it's your decision.

community_verifier.dialogue: I understand that results get paid, but if we don't pay them, my people won't get any treatment, let alone too little.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: They're trying. I'm seeing it in my hospitals. The problem is with our wupply line. If we had the necessary supplies, we could easily meet these goals.

problems.name: Government Vs. Organization
problems.initiating_dialogue: I'm getting a different answer from everyone, so I'll ask you to straighten them out. The Ministry, NGO, and health care providers can't agree on who has jurisdiction where and what we're supposed to do for patients.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Best way to win an argument? End the conversation.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_11: I do hope this is the last time we have to go through this.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I'm only doing what I thought you asked me to. If I'm not let me know.

feedback.warning_17: Okay, we'll let the health care providers have their autonomy.
feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_7: The whole reason you brought us on was nothing was getting accomplished. That's what we were doing and now you're telling us not to.

coach.dialogue: The health care providers are caught between the people paying them and the Ministry they report to. That's the problem that needs solving.

feedback.hold_stakeholder_meeting_5: For a problem like this, a truce is about as good as we can hope for. Well, maybe not a truce, as such. More of a cease fire.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: There's plenty of work to be done without these arguments.

community_verifier.dialogue: The other day, a woman was telling me about her prenatal checkup. She's in the stirrups and the doctor had to leave the examination room to get lectured on what all care she was supposed to give. That has got to stop.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I couldn't do what the NGO Director does. No argument there. But they are not so good at their job that they can do mine, too.

problems.name: Lack of Supplies
problems.initiating_dialogue: Bad news. We have surveyed many patients from the hospitals and local clinics, and at every focus group, someone reports being turned away without services.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If people are being turned away, it's because funds are being mismanaged. Sanctions may be the only thing that makes a difference.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: This is a serious problem. It's hard enough getting people to hospitals even when services are abundant.

feedback.increase_supply_budget_2: We have increased the budget every year. I am not optimistic this will solve the problem.

ngo_manager.dialogue: This is a problem at the provider level. You should issue them a warning. Or if you prefer, I can do so.

feedback.warn_ngo_4: Warning received. I'll discuss this with our health providers and work on a solution.
feedback.grant_facilities_autonomy_2: This problem is due to facilities mismanaging what they are given, not my budget lines. It's not a good idea to give them more responsibility when they've done such a bad job with what they have.
feedback.sanction_ngo_3: How are we supposed to accomplish anything if you keep handicapping us? You understand this is going to affect care outcomes.

coach.dialogue: I'm not sure why, but these facilities are always low on supplies. Maybe the budget's been set too low.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The numbers are poor, but at least the facilities don't appear to be exaggerating them.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: We put in requests for supplies, but they are not filled in a timely way. We get too much of some things, and not enough of others. If we could order our own supplies directly, this wouldn't be a problem, but the Ministry sets our orders down to the exact number of syringes.

feedback.warn_providers_3: I'm at a loss. I'll hold a meeting with my staff and the RBF Coach and try to figure out how to resolve this.

problems.name: Staff Issues
problems.initiating_dialogue: In many of my focus groups, there's an air of mistrust with the hospitals and clinics. People who go there have experienced terrible service, and word's getting around.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We're paying for the NGO to administrate the logistics of this plan, and if they aren't doing so effectively, it might help to remind them who they're working for.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Providers in my region have complained often of over-stressed staff. There are not enough workers, and supplies are still running out frequently.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I am not sure what the issue is exactly.

feedback.warn_ngo_5: I'll do what I can, but we're struggling as it is. I don't know how we can improve.

coach.dialogue: Customer service is a huge part of quality of care. If staff aren't doing it now, we need to increase incentives.

feedback.increase_customer_service_incentives_2: I'll notify everyone about the change. I think we'll see a big difference soon.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: Providers struggle to meet their quality of care milestones. Bad service is half the problem. It might not be my place to say so, but firing staff and hiring new people might be the best way to go.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I have less control over my staff than you might think. When we struggle to fill demand on a day to day basis, there isn't much time left over for morale-building and discipline.

feedback.reorganize_staff_2: More orders from on high about who I can hire? Just thinking about how long it will take to train all these people to where my current staff is makes me mad. And that will happen after I fire my people.
feedback.sanction_ngo_4: You realize that when you sanction the NGO, the money tends to come out of my budget? You cannot keep doing this to us.

problems.name: Reach
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're seeing underserved populations throughout the south. The NGO is falling short of their promises, especially in this area.

feedback.increase_funding_for_ngo_2: You realize you're rewarding these people for failure? I don't want to step in on this issue. Don't make me.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We're seeing underserved populations throughout the south. The NGO is falling short of their promises, especially in this area.

ngo_manager.dialogue: It's been a lot harder to reach some populations than we expected, especially down there. Health facilities in this region are much shorter on supplies and staff than we originally estimated, and there's no budget for us to make up the shortfall.

feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_9: We can't, cannot, get to absolutely everyone, so you're making it impossible to get health care for everyone else. That's self-defeating!
feedback.contract_additional_ngo_2: I think we could have done it, but it would be a lot of work to reach that province. I appreciate the help.

coach.dialogue: Look, we have one group running things pretty well for most of the country. Maybe we need someone to run support for them who's more used to this kind of issue.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm sure they are having trouble getting to some people, but no informational campaign is going to reach everybody.

community_verifier.dialogue: You can always just guide the NGO on how they should address this. It might be kind of micro-manage-y, but that's what you have a coach for, right?

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I have less control over my staff than you might think. When we struggle to fill demand on a day to day basis, there isn't much time left over for morale-building and discipline.

feedback.reorganize_staff_2: More orders from on high about who I can hire? Just thinking about how long it will take to train all these people to where my current staff is makes me mad. And that will happen after I fire my people.
feedback.sanction_ngo_4: You realize that when you sanction the NGO, the money tends to come out of my budget? You cannot keep doing this to us.

problems.name: Budget Lines
problems.initiating_dialogue: My hospitals are reporting that they can't meet their quality goals this quarter, but they're blaming the NGO's budget. I don't know how the NGO expects to reach goals if they won't let the hospitals deliver quality care.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We have a pretty good sense of how budgeting was working and where we can improve it if you give us back the authority.

feedback.advise_to_follow_budget_restrictions_1: OK, we'll make do. We always have.

ngo_manager.dialogue: This is results-based financing. We're responsible for the results, so let us decide on the financing.

feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers_2: That's fine by me, but let's discuss it at the end of the year. It's a pretty big change.
feedback.move_authority_to_ministry_3: I really thought we were supposed to handle this, but if the Ministry wants to, that's fine.

coach.dialogue: Hate to say it, but the NGO has too much power over the budget. We should alter the plan to allow providers to make these decisions at their level.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm seeing the hospitals struggling, but that might just be growing pains. Missing goals for one quarter isn't the end of the world.

community_verifier.dialogue: My only concern is people not getting care because the budget keeps getting tied up in arguments.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I've already made myself clear on this a number of times. The RBF Coach knows exactly what the problem is.

problems.name: Midwives
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're having a lot of trouble hitting goals for facility births. We're short-staffed, especially when it comes to midwives.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: This might be our most important indicator. Our infant mortality rate is abysmal, and if more money gets those numbers down, I'll argue for it.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: That would explain the struggling indicators on facility births. An alternative I've considered is allowing outreach staff to serve as midwives in the field, if facilities are overstressed.

feedback.advise_to_follow_budget_restrictions_1: OK, we'll make do. We always have.

ngo_manager.dialogue: If you can verify this, we'd be willing to discuss the budget.

feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers_3: We'll do whatever you think is best, though this is a pretty major change. Let's discuss this at the end of the year.
feedback.request_budget_for_more_midwives_1: We can allow this, but we'll pay close attention to the results.

coach.dialogue: The Hospital Administrator has complained to me in private about not being able to hire staff members without NGO approval. The plan is set up that way, but if we granted them autonomy to make hiring choices, things would run more smoothly.

feedback.allow_outreach_staff_to_act_as_midwives_: This would boost our facility births for sure, but it's a bit of a cheat since they won't technically be in facilities. Whatever gets babies delivered safely, though.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The RBF Coach has been in regular contact with the Hospital Administrator, they might be able to offer a perspective on things.

community_verifier.dialogue: I've heard this complaint from several women in my community. They say there are long waits to meet with midwives. It puts strain on everyone. Pregnancy is trying even in the best of conditions.

problems.name: New Budget
problems.initiating_dialogue: I received a memo today going over the new budget for all health facilities. The NGO has released new hiring guidelines, but these do not match our goals.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: This is par for the course. Providers always complain about budget changes.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If the NGO is claiming this is necessary, I would take it seriously. A compromise might be to rework the business plan with Ministry oversight.

ngo_manager.dialogue: Our own monitors have found hospitals mismanaging funds. They need strict guidelines to provide the necessary services. Maybe one of your verifiers or advisors can confirm?

feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers_4: If you think it's essential, we won't fight you over authority. But the plan will need to be altered to account for this change.

coach.dialogue: These problems have been going on for too long. The only way I see this working in the future is reducing the NGO's outsized control over the budget and granting autonomy to the providers to hire staff as needed.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I have noticed some inconsistencies in the data that indicate to me some funds are being mismanaged. The hospital can fix that problem themselves.

community_verifier.dialogue: I don't understand the need for these new guidelines, but then again, I'm not working in the hospital.

feedback.rework_business_plan_2: I don't believe this will be constructive, but I'm willing to try.

problems.name: Process V Results Again
problems.initiating_dialogue: Vaccination prices went up, so we couldn't hit our numbers again. But if we don't get our bonus, next quarter could be a disaster.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: You can ask the Regional Director and providers directly. The NGO wants autonomy, so you'll have to do your research.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: No, they didn't meet their goals, but that doesn't mean my providers and their patients should suffer for it.

feedback.allow_payments_once_5: It's good to know we can count on you just like you're counting on us.
feedback.deny_payment_5: We're struggling with these numbers as it is. It hurts patients when we don't have money to work with.

coach.dialogue: I don't think the NGO is managing as well as they could, but maybe we need to adjust our expectations.

feedback.revise_indicators_at_end_of_year_4: Okay, at year's end I'll sit the fundholder down with the NGO and we'll figure out some realistic goals. In the meantime, we'll hold payment.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: It's the same as last time, and until someone says they're making numbers when they're actually making them up, it's not mine to say.

community_verifier.dialogue: The other day I followed up with a woman who vaccinated her son against dengue right before the mosquitos got bad. The numbers aren't great, but if the payments stop, that'll be worse.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I'm worried that it's not just the prices of these services that's the problem. Even if I had all the money in the world, I couldn't spend it on the supplies I need, since my budget is handed to me by the NGO.

problems.name: Prescriptions
problems.initiating_dialogue: I've been interviewing patients, and at least at the clinics there's a serious quality of care issue. People have been leaving with what appears to be completely wrong prescriptions.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: That's unacceptable. I think it's time we looked for someone else to fulfill these duties. Letting the NGO go and contracting facilities directly would give us far better oversight.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We must conduct an investigation right away. Begin by speaking directly with the health providers and find out why this is happening.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I run the entire health network of Zariba and can't be everywhere at once. In the end, I am responsible, but I'm not being given the support I need.

feedback.warning_18: Everyone who works for me is doing their best. I don't know what I can do without an increase in resources.
feedback.sanctions_16: I need an increase in resources to deal with this, not a cut! How can I fix this problem if I'm hamstrung by sanctions?

coach.dialogue: This sounds like we've been incentivising the wrong things. Adhering to best practices is much more important than happy patients. Let's rethink this.

feedback.reduce_incentives_for_customer_service_2: I know I pushed hard for patient satisfaction, but that might have been... misguided. Let's implement this and see what happens.
feedback.tie_incentives_directly_to_protocol_2: I'll work on implementing this change. I think this will prove to be a turning point in the plan.
feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_10: I'll inform the NGO and begin transitioning into contracting directly with providers early next year.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: This is a mess. I should have caught this myself. I'll look more closely to see what else is being misreported.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: At first I was shocked to hear this, but the more I thought about it, the more it makes sense. Patients don't know the difference, and if we're incentivizing happy patients, the wrong medicine is better than no medicine.

problems.name: Missing Goals
problems.initiating_dialogue: I hate to say it, but things are not going well. The NGO routinely misses its goals, and our indicators have not risen as predicted. We're thinking about declaring the plan DOA, cancelling it next year, and returning to traditional financing.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: As much as it pains me to say so, I agree with the Deputy Minister. We need to change our approach.

ngo_manager.dialogue: The problem is at the level of providers and always has been. If we terminate the hospital's contract, we can find another provider to fill their role and salvage our project.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_8: If we couldn't make this work, nobody can. The past three years have been an unmitigated disaster.
feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers_5: Let's schedule a meeting to discuss this at the end of the year. I might be able to persuade the Minister to give us one more year with an altered plan.

coach.dialogue: There must be another solution here. I'm committed to making this plan work. Even with new health providers and without the assistance of the NGO.

feedback.return_to_traditional_financing_2: Part of me feels like the past three years have been wasted, but I guess there's no sense in throwing good money out after bad. It's been a pleasure working with you.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I've heard a lot of complaining, but it amounts to finger pointing. Can you fire everybody? Except me, that is.

community_verifier.dialogue: Seems like you're getting yelled at by both sides. That's rough, but you'll figure it out.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I heard through the grapevine what's happening. I know there have been issues, but I believe the problem is and has been the bureaucracy from the NGO's office. If you grant us autonomy to hire staff as needed and order supplies to fulfill our patients' needs, things have to improve.

feedback.terminate_hospital_contract_1: This is so disappointing. I did everything I could to make this plan work and help people.

tactics.name: Lack of Information
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Community verifier says opinions about health care facilities aren't changing, and people are not changing much.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Most people have not heard about the changes.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_provider_ambassadors: This can begin next year if we revise the contracts to include it.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_invite_community_leaders: Like it or not, we're still outsiders or working for outsiders. It's a good idea to get some leaders on our side.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_word_of_mouth: This will only work if we keep doing good work, but word of mouth campaigns have worked in the past.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Misinformation
tactics.initiating_dialogue: People have been coming to facilities totally confused about what services are being supplemented and how to get them.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Misinformation is circulating about how the plan works.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_funding_for_sensitiz: This should work as long as we can relate it directly to the problems we're having. And we can get the materials printed.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_create_informational_pamphlet: Let's just hope the language is clear enough and we get the pamphlets in time.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Printing Issues
tactics.initiating_dialogue: We are running out of pamphlets at most facilities.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The printer we hired to create them is unreliable and keeps missing print deadlines, sometimes by many weeks. I could look for new printers, or we could let facilities produce their own materials. We'd need to provide equipment and materials, though.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: It'll cost more, but I guess this is what we get for going with the cheapest option. We'll have to find room for that in the budget.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_provide_health_facilities_wit: This ended up being more of a cost than we realized, since now we have employees printing these up, which cuts into their time. And if they all need ink at the same time, we're doomed.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_budget_for_printing_: Hopefully we aren't just throwing money at a problem, but somebody needs to do this. I'll reach out to the bulk printer and look into raising our quantities.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Overprescription
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The community verifier tells me doctors are prescribing unnecessary medicines, which puts a strain on patients.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Patients aren't happy unless they leave the hospital with a prescription, so doctors prescribe them something innocuous.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_limit_prescriptions: If they need fewer, they'll have an empty pad burning a hole in their pocket. If they need more, it'll be a nightmare.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_following_set_pro: We're counting on the promise of incentives outweighing the headache of a cranky patient, but it doesn't help people to give them a bunch of medicine they don't need.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_retrain_doctors: This is mostly a bedside manner problem, and reminding doctors they're allowed to say 'no' is a lot cheaper than paying them to.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Wrong Procedures
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Verifiers have seen some patients getting incorrect or unnecessary prescriptions.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: When patients have a problem it is easier to perform a procedure that might not help than to refer them elsewhere for the right procedure.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_create_robust_referral_system: If the problem persists, then our providers are not leveling with us. It should fix the problem, though.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_following_set_pro: I get it's annoying to reward people for not breaking the rules, but if they feel the referral process is such a pain, that's what we have to do.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_referrals: I hope we don't hear about unnecessary referrals next.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Infection Rates
tactics.initiating_dialogue: There's been a sharp uptick in infections recently and it's probably on us.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Surprise! Sanitization protocols are not being followed and that's why people are getting these awful infections.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_sanitization_prot: It smacks of gold star rewards for kids. 'Wash your hands, children!' Oh well. As long as it doesn't drain the discretionary budget too much.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_best_practices: If we're going to give them money, we might as well ask them to try a little harder than 'good enough not to maybe kill somebody.'
